SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.ic.libICMath
Class ICCalculatorBase

java.lang.Object
  com.ic.libICMath.ICCalculatorBase

public class ICCalculatorBase
extends java.lang.Object

The class that handles all of the variables and evaluations for ICFunctions to allow expression evaluation, variable and sub function storage, as well as statistics for evaluation time and even the ability to use a listener to run events when variables and or functions are added or removed.

Since:
1.0
Version:
1.0
Author:
Ean Lombardo

Nested Class Summary
static interface ICCalculatorBase.Errors
          Contains constants for every error that can happen in an ICCalculatorBase
static class ICCalculatorBase.Settings
          A class that handles settings for the ICCalculatorBase, meant to be overloaded so you can save and load settings however you want.
 class ICCalculatorBase.VariableFunctionChangeListener
          This is the class listener that will be called when a function and/or variable is add or removed from it's parent ICCalculatorBase
 
Field Summary
 int[] builtInFunctionParameterCounts
          An array that contains how many parameters each functions take
 long endTime
          This will contain the end time in nanoseconds after each evaluation
 int evalError
          This will contain the error code for any error that happens while evaluating after each evaluation
 ICFunction evaluationFunction
          This is a nameless function that is used by the ICCalculatorBase for expression evaluation
 java.util.ArrayList<ICFunction> functions
          Holds the user created functions that are declared within this ICCalculator base for the calculator to use
 java.util.ArrayList<ICFunction> graphingFunctions
          Cross references with the functions ArrayList to know what functions are to be graphed
 int parseError
          This will contain the error code for any error that happens while the function is parsing after each evaluation
 java.util.Random randGen
          Standard java pseudo random number generation, used for functions who need to use pseudo random numbers
 java.lang.String RPN
          This string will contain the reverse polish notation of the last expression evaluated via the ICFuntion and ICMathToken classes
 ICCalculatorBase.Settings settings
          This is the standard settings object to be overridden to allow any sort of loading and saving you would want, the class as it is now is default settings
 long startTime
          This will contain the start time in nanoseconds after each evaluation
 java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> variableReps
          Holds the string that are the names of the variables for the calculator to use
 java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> variableValues
          Holds the values of the variables for the calculator to use

Constructor Detail

ICCalculatorBase

public ICCalculatorBase(ICCalculatorBase.Settings prefs)
The main constructor for the ICCalculatorBase class, sets up the setting system, sets some default variables and initializes the random number generator

Parameters:
prefs - the ICCalculatorBase.Settings class the ICCalculatorBase should use for settings
Method Detail

setVariable

public void setVariable(java.lang.String var,
                        double val)
Sets a variable to a value in the ICCalculatorBase, if the variable doesn't exist it will be created

Parameters:
var - The name of the variable
val - The value of the variable

getVariable

public double getVariable(java.lang.String var)
Gets the value of the variable from the ICCalculatorBase

Parameters:
var - The name of the variable the you want
Returns:
The value of the variable

evalExpression

public double evalExpression(java.lang.String expression)
Evaluates an expression with the ICCalculatorBase using an ICFunction, any functions or variables created by this expression will be put into this ICCalculatorBase. Afterwards errors will be set in this ICCalculatorBase as well as start and stop time, and the the variable "Ans" will be set to the value of the expression

Parameters:
expression - The expression that you want evaluated
Returns:
The value of the evaluated expression

stringEvalExpression

public java.lang.String stringEvalExpression(java.lang.String expression)
Evaluates an expression with the ICCalculatorBase using an ICFunction returning a string for the answer, this is for convenience as it will give you the string of your double answer or a string about the error it had, any functions or variables created by this expression will be put into this ICCalculatorBase. Afterwards errors will be set in this ICCalculatorBase as well as start and stop time, and the the variable "Ans" will be set to the value of the expression

Parameters:
expression - The expression that you want evaluated
Returns:
The value of the expression as a string, or an explanation of the error that prevented the expressions evaluation

getErrorString

public java.lang.String getErrorString()
Gets the string that is detailed info on what error occurred on the last calculation

Returns:
Information on the evaluation or parse error

calcError

public boolean calcError()
Gets whether or not there was an error in the last evaluation

Returns:
(true,false) Whether or not there was an error in the last evaluation

createFunction

public boolean createFunction(java.lang.String name,
                              java.lang.String f,
                              java.lang.String of)
Creates a new function in the ICCalculatorBase, to be used by other expressions or possibly for graphing

Parameters:
name - The name of the functions
f - The expression of the function
of - The defendant variable of the function, the variable that is replaced by the input
Returns:
(true,false) True, unless there was an error with creating the function

getEvalTime

public int getEvalTime()
Gets the time in nanoseconds that it took for evaluation of the last expression

Returns:
The time in nanoseconds that the last evaluation took

getError

public int getError()
Gets the error code of the parse or evaluation error that happened in the last evaluation

Returns:
The error code from the last evaluation

setListener

public void setListener(ICCalculatorBase.VariableFunctionChangeListener listener)
Set's the VariableFunctionChangeListener for this ICCalculatorCase, the member functions of this class will be called as changes happen in this ICCalculatorClass

Parameters:
listener - The listener for this class to use

invalidate

public void invalidate()
Invalidates the ICCalculator base by calling the the listener about a change and does anything it needs too to reset itself, which is currently nothing.

functionExists

public boolean functionExists(java.lang.String name)
Gets whether or not a function exists in this ICCalculatorBase

Parameters:
name - the name of the function your looking for
Returns:
(true,false) true if the function does exist in this ICCalculatorBase

setConstants

public void setConstants()
Sets the standard constants in the ICCalculatorBase
